definition: spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
weary
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: Four hours on the tennis court fagged me out.
sentences.chinese: 在网球场上的四个小时令我精疲力尽语源。

sentences.english: The exercises should cause exhaustion after the total repetitions are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种锻炼在所有的重复完毕后应该使自己精疲力尽。

sentences.english: Atzel was so exhausted with happiness that he slept right through it.
sentences.chinese: 阿采尔快乐得精疲力尽，整个葬礼过程中都沉睡着。

sentences.english: But after the marathon, he's done too much.
sentences.chinese: 跑完马拉松以后，他已经精疲力尽了。

sentences.english: And yet the mood of this exhausted country is far from jubilant.
sentences.chinese: 然而这个精疲力尽的国家其心情远谈不上高兴。

sentences.english: He'll never give up work; he'll go on until he pegs out.
sentences.chinese: 他决不中途放下工作，定要干到精疲力尽为止。

sentences.english: Rowing on the lake all day long, we were rowed out.
sentences.chinese: 我们在湖上划了一整天的船，划得精疲力尽。

sentences.english: Let's say that you've been at work all day and you are really tired.
sentences.chinese: 假设你已经工作了一整天，你已经精疲力尽了。

sentences.english: At last, drained of all tears, she lay down on the couch and fell at once into a deep and exhausted sleep.
sentences.chinese: 终于，她的泪流干了，精疲力尽，躺在沙发上睡着了。

sentences.english: They were tired from all the last-minute shopping and the excitement of Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 最后一刻的购物和圣诞节的激动已使他们精疲力尽。

sentences.english: I was that bone-tired, after working for scores of hours.
sentences.chinese: 工作了十几个小时候，我累的精疲力尽。

sentences.english: He set a course for his home, and exhausted, fell asleep. Clouds rolled in.
sentences.chinese: 他将航线调向回家的路，然后精疲力尽，睡着了。

sentences.english: because you can tell that you and all of your team members are very tired.
sentences.chinese: 你感觉到团队成员们，包括你自己都已经精疲力尽。
那个工作弄得他“精疲力尽”。

sentences.english: I'm shagged out after the work.
sentences.chinese: 我被这些工作搞得精疲力尽。

definition: body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
physically and emotionally exhausted
tired/exhausted
to be both mentally and physically exhausted (idiom)
beaten/exhausted/tired
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
to pant/to gasp for breath
tired/weary
to tire/tired
worn out in body and soul (idiom)
to breathe heavily like an ox (idiom)/to huff and puff
bruised/riddled with scars
lit. dark sky and black earth (idiom)/fig. pitch dark/to black out/disorderly/troubled times
